intro: Hieracium brachysoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium brachysoma is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in open landscapes.
